TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed XmlReadMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies how to read XML data and a relational schema into a <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet">.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the members of this enumeration when setting the parameter of the <xref:System.Data.DataSet.ReadXml%2A> method.
> [!NOTE] > `Auto` mode may be slower than setting XmlReadMode to an explicit option.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.XmlReadMode Auto = int32(0)

remarks.format:
## Remarks Performs the most appropriate of these actions:
If the data is a DiffGram, sets to `DiffGram`.
-or-
If the dataset already has a schema, or the document contains an in-line schema, sets to `ReadSchema`.
-or-
If the dataset does not already have a schema and the document does not contain an in-line schema, sets to `InferSchema`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.XmlReadMode DiffGram = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Reads a DiffGram, applying changes from the DiffGram to the <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet">. The semantics are identical to those of a M:System.Data.DataSet.Merge(System.Data.DataSet)?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True operation. As with the M:System.Data.DataSet.Merge(System.Data.DataSet)?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True operation, P:System.Data.DataRow.RowState?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True values are preserved. Input to M:System.Data.DataSet.ReadXml(System.Xml.XmlReader)?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True with DiffGrams should only be obtained using the output from M:System.Data.DataSet.WriteXml(System.IO.Stream)?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True as a DiffGram.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The target T:System.Data.DataSet?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True must have the same schema as the T:System.Data.DataSet?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True on which M:System.Data.DataSet.WriteXml(System.IO.Stream)?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True as DiffGram is called. Otherwise the DiffGram merge operation fails, and an exception is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.XmlReadMode Fragment = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Reads XML fragments, such as those generated by executing FOR XML queries, against an instance of SQL Server. When XmlReadMode is set to `Fragment`, the default namespace is read as the inline schema.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.XmlReadMode IgnoreSchema = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Ignores any inline schema and reads data into the existing <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet"> schema. If any data does not match the existing schema, it is discarded (including data from differing namespaces defined for the <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet">). If the data is a DiffGram, `IgnoreSchema` has the same functionality as `DiffGram`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.XmlReadMode InferSchema = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Ignores any inline schema, infers schema from the data and loads the data. If the <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet"> already contains a schema, the current schema is extended by adding new tables or adding columns to existing tables. An exception is thrown if the inferred table already exists but with a different namespace, or if any of the inferred columns conflict with existing columns.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.XmlReadMode InferTypedSchema = int32(6)

Docs.summary: Ignores any inline schema, infers a strongly typed schema from the data, and loads the data. If the type cannot be inferred from the data, it is interpreted as string data. If the T:System.Data.DataSet?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True already contains a schema, the current schema is extended, either by adding new tables or by adding columns to existing tables. An exception is thrown if the inferred table already exists but with a different namespace, or if any of the inferred columns conflict with existing columns.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.XmlReadMode ReadSchema = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Reads any inline schema and loads the data. If the <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet"> already contains schema, new tables may be added to the schema, but an exception is thrown if any tables in the inline schema already exist in the <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet">.
